net.sf.gogui.gtp
Class GtpCommand

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.gogui.gtp.GtpCommand

public class GtpCommand
extends java.lang.Object

GTP command. Handles parsing the command line and storing the response to the command. Arguments containing whitespaces can be quoted with double quotes ("). The responses are allowed to contain consecutive new lines. They will be replaced in GtpEngine.mainLoop() by lines containing a single space to form a valid GTP response.

getColorArg

public GoColor getColorArg()
                    throws GtpError
Get single color argument. Valid color strings are "b", "w", "black", "white" and the corresponding uppercase strings.

Returns:
The color.
Throws:
GtpError - If command has not exactly one argument or argument is not a color.

getPointArg

public GoPoint getPointArg(int i,
                           int boardSize)
                    throws GtpError
Get point argument. Valid point strings are as in GtpUtil.parsePoint (uppercase or lowercase coordinates, e.g. "A1", or "pass").

Parameters:
i - The index of the argument (starting with zero).
boardSize - The board size (points will be checked to be within this board size).
Returns:
The point.
Throws:
GtpError - If command has not enough arguments or argument is not a valid point.

getPointListArg

public PointList getPointListArg(int boardSize)
                          throws GtpError
Get point arguments. Valid point strings are as in GtpUtil.parsePoint (uppercase or lowercase coordinates, e.g. "A1", or "pass"). All arguments will be parsed as points.

Parameters:
boardSize - The board size (points will be checked to be within this board size).
Returns:
Point list containg the points.
Throws:
GtpError - If at least one argument is not a valid point.

getLine

public java.lang.String getLine()

Returns:
The command line without ID.

getNuArg

public int getNuArg()
Get number of arguments.

Returns:
The number of arguments.

getResponse

public java.lang.StringBuilder getResponse()
Get string buffer for construction the response. The response to the command can be constructed by appending to this string buffer.

getId

public int getId()
Get command ID. It is allowed to call this function if command has no ID, but the returned value is undefined.

Returns:
The command ID.

isQuit

public boolean isQuit()
Check if command is quit command. DEPRECATED: Fix GtpEngine to use only GtpEngine.m_quit

Returns:
true, if command name is "quit".

setResponse

public void setResponse(java.lang.String response)
Set the response. Clears the string buffer containg the response and sets it to the given string.

Parameters:
response - The string containing the new response.
